newsitem.title: CANADA: Toronto stocks end mixed after three-day rally.
newsitem.headline: Toronto stocks end mixed after three-day rally.

text.p: Toronto stocks finished mixed on Friday, as investors took profits after a record three-day rally on Canada's biggest stock market.
The TSE 300 Composite Index slipped 4.88 points to 6780.27, but not before setting an intraday high of 6803.71.
Trading was moderate compared to recent sessions. Almost 86 million shares changed hands, worth C$1.46 billion ($1.05 billion).

"People are anxiously looking to the weekend. They need a little money to spend so they took some money out of the market," said Fred Ketchen, senior vice-president and director of equity trading for ScotiaMcLeod Inc.
The hardest hit sectors were conglomerates, pipelines, retailing and banking. Communications and precious metals led gains in six of 14 sub-groups.
The flood of corporate earnings that energized equities this week was expected to slow next week, Ketchen said.
"The flood is starting to turn into a trickle. The question is what do people start looking to next?" he said.
Advancing stocks outpaced declines 484 to 466, with 344 issues unchanged.
* Canadian Pacific Ltd. fell 1.05 to close at 42.25.
CP shares pushed the conglomerates group to new heights earlier this week after reporting fatter profits.
* Among other stocks hit by profit takers, Northern Telecom Ltd. dropped 2.25 to 142.75. Canadian National Railway Co. slipped 0.55 to 69.25.
* Linamar Corp. jumped 3.15 to 73.15 after it posted sharply higher second-quarter profits late on Thursday. West Fraser Timber added 2.50 to 45 on stronger earnings.
* Rio Alto Exploration Ltd. gained 0.10 to 11.90 after the company said it would issue 6.5 million common shares at C$11.75 ($8.50) each on a bought deal basis.
